abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention advises pregnant women to 'consider postponing nonessential' travel to 11 Southeast Asian countries reporting outbreak of Zika virus.

headline.print_headline: A New Zika Advisory for Pregnant Women
headline.main: C.D.C. Advises Against Travel to Zika-Affected Countries in Southeast Asia

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations

snippet: The warning from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention cited 11 countries and was not as urgent as those issued earlier this year regarding Latin America and the Caribbean....
lead_paragraph: The warning from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention cited 11 countries and was not as urgent as those issued earlier this year regarding Latin America and the Caribbean.
